t: Proverbs 28
The*pn wicked flee when no one pursues, But*ld the righteous are bold as a lion.
Because*ln of the transgression of a land, many are*i its princes; But*ld by a man of understanding and*i knowledge Right*ld will be prolonged.
A*ln poor man who oppresses the poor Is*ild like*i a driving rain which leaves no food.
Those*ln who forsake the law praise the wicked, But*ld such as keep the law contend with them.
Evil*ln men do not understand justice, But*ld those who seek the Lord*s understand all.
Better*ln is*i the poor who walks in his integrity Than*ld one perverse in*i his*i ways, though he be*i rich.
Whoever*ln keeps the law is*i a discerning son, But*ld a companion of gluttons shames his father.
One*ln who increases his possessions by usury and extortion Gathers*ld it for him who will pity the poor.
One*ln who turns away his ear from hearing the law, Even*ld his prayer is*i an abomination.
Whoever*ln causes the upright to go astray in an evil way, He*ld himself will fall into his own pit; But*ld the blameless will inherit good.
The*ln rich man is*i wise in his own eyes, But*ld the poor who has understanding searches him out.
When*ln the righteous rejoice, there*i is*i great glory; But*ld when the wicked arise, men hide themselves.
He*ln who covers his sins will not prosper, But*ld whoever confesses and forsakes them*i will have mercy.
Happy*ln is*i the man who is always reverent, But*ld he who hardens his heart will fall into calamity.
Like*iln a roaring lion and a charging bear Is*ild a wicked ruler over poor people.
A*ln ruler who lacks understanding is*i a great oppressor, But*ild he who hates covetousness will prolong his*i days.
A*ln man burdened with bloodshed will flee into a pit; Let*ld no one help him.
Whoever*ln walks blamelessly will be saved, But*ld he*i who*i is*i perverse in*i his*i ways will suddenly fall.
He*ln who tills his land will have plenty of bread, But*ld he who follows frivolity will have poverty enough!
A*ln faithful man will abound with blessings, But*ld he who hastens to be rich will not go unpunished.
To*ln show partiality is*i not good, Because*ld for a piece of bread a man will transgress.
A*ln man with an evil eye hastens after riches, And*ld does not consider that poverty will come upon him.
He*ln who rebukes a man will find more favor afterward Than*ld he who flatters with the tongue.
Whoever*ln robs his father or his mother, And*ld says, “It*i is*i no transgression,” The*ld same is*i companion to a destroyer.
He*ln who is of a proud heart stirs up strife, But*ld he who trusts in the Lord*s will be prospered.
He*ln who trusts in his own heart is a fool, But*ld whoever walks wisely will be delivered.
He*ln who gives to the poor will not lack, But*ld he who hides his eyes will have many curses.
When*ln the wicked arise, men hide themselves; But*ld when they perish, the righteous increase.
